lines.text: Dang! Are you seeing this, Leo?
What? The table?
Yeah, the table! It’s got a real nice ‘gram, here.
A pentagram?
Isn’t that the shape wizards use to cast evil spells?
Yeah, Leo. It’s the shape wizards use to cast evil spells.
There’s no artistry or subtle craftsmanship involved. It’s just a shape, and it’s just so evil.
Don’t get smart with me, kid. That thing’s for summonin' demons, right?
You can use it to summon a demon, sure…
But they- they’ve got a wide variety of applications, depending on the way you inscribe the-
You draw the shape different and it does different stuff?
You’re oversimplifying.
Maybe, kid. Maybe.
I’m not here to gawk at how good your dead wizard buddies are at geometry, alright?
Tell me what that thing was for!
It, uh…
Well, I can’t really say, actually. It looks like it burnt up before they could finish it.
Finish it?
Y’know, finish it. Detail stuff. Runes, sigils, inscriptions… the works.
It’s a basic tool for sacrificial rituals- without more context, I can’t say what they were up to.
You can’t just… analyze the trace magics, or somethin'?
If this were a dead architect, and you handed me a piece of blank grid paper to analyze…
Fine, fine. Just… keep that thing in mind.
This table looks like it burnt up before anyone could use it to do any... rituals or whatever.
